FuncDef: The display access https-redirect blacklist command displays information about the blacklist generated during HTTPS redirection.
CLIs: display access https-redirect blacklist { ip | ipv6 } slot <slotid>

ParaDef.Info:
Displays IPv4 address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Displays IPv6 address.
The value is a 32-digit hexadecimal number, in the format of X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

Specifies a slot ID.
The value is a string of 1 to 16 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Examples: [~HUAWEI] display access https-redirect blacklist ipv6 slot 1
[~HUAWEI] display access https-redirect blacklist ip slot 1
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To check whether an IP address added to the HTTPS redirection blacklist is correct, run the display access https-redirect blacklist command to view information about the HTTPS redirection blacklist.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
